name: Aston at Papakea Resort

reviews.title: Anti Smoker Hotel - Smokers Should Boycott
reviews.text: Not Good if you're looking for a tropical Hawaiian setting. This place is more like apartments on the beach. Actually some are apartments. A lot of older people (70-90+). Beach is tiny to non existent at high tide. Swimming is hazardous. I consider myself a courtious smoker but this place goes overboard. Smoking is discouraged anywhere on prop even though Hawaii law permits smoking more that 20 ft from a building. Other Hotels allow smoking as long as you're away from buildings, I suggest if you're a smoker to ask first.I wouldn't stay here again.

reviews.title: Cockroaches!
reviews.text: One word: cockroaches!!!!

reviews.title: Great time but will not stay again
reviews.text: As soon as we checked in and got to the door we found a notice about "regular pest cleaning". The notice said that if guests had a baby they could be exempted from the procedure but then all roaches would move to that condo. We had a toddler, and asked to be exempted since he would put everything he sees in the mouth. The reason we stayed was that we thought if they did this procedure on regular basis then the pest problem could not be that bad. We were wrong! Every time I turned on lights in the bathroom or kitchen I've noticed little "crawlers".

reviews.title: Loved the Papakea
reviews.text: The condo was very old, kitchen was awful and empty. We had to buy everything starting from dishwasher liquid and detergent, and finishing with salt, sugar, oil, e.t.c. Well, all was for nothing, after cockroach encounter I just did not want to cook at that place. We tried to be out as much as possible. The sofa bad we slept on had a plastic wrapper on it, and a fitted sheet on top. We finally took it off on the third day of stay. Changing resorts was not an option since it would be very expensive for us.

reviews.title: A GREAT First Trip to Hawaii
reviews.text: One positive thing - a cleaning lady. She was extremely nice and did her job beautifully.

reviews.title: Fantastic Family Vacation at the beautiful Papakea Resort
reviews.text: We stayed at the Papakea Resort for a full week in mid-August and had one of the most wonderful vactions we have ever had. The resort was incredible with breath taking views of the ocean and of the fantastic gardens at the resort from our one bedroom suite. The staff did a great job taking care of our every need. The expedia.com team that helps guests with their activities were very helpful and honest with all their recommendations. We went to their orientation on our first morning there and in a fast paced effort so as not to waste any of our valuable time provided info that helped us make selections about what we wanted to do and confirmed all our choices. They also made several reservations for us during the week. We all participated in the onsite activities such as yoga by the ocean and water aerobics several mornings. The resort is located just north of the Kaanapali area where all the major chain resorts (Sheraton, Hyatt) are located which made it great so you could avoid all the hustle and noise there each night, but close enough that you could be in the middle of it if you wanted to. The staff at the hotel did a great job of cleaning our room every few days without any charge, they changed our beach towels at the front desk as often as we needed them changed when we came back from all the beautiful beaches that were close by and were as helpful as they could be. The room had everything you could possibly need and it was very clean and comfortable. The beds and pillows were really nice. The pools at the resort were fantastic with plenty of lounge chairs and grills to cook on. The resort has well manicured grass that goes right up to the ocean retaining wall where you could stay out of the sand if you wanted to and still walk down the steps and you were in the waves. We couldn't have had a better time and enjoyed every minute of our stay. We really missed the Papakea Resort duing the next week when we went to Oahu and stayed at the Embassy Suites there on Wakaki Beach.

reviews.title: Wonderful view, beautiful grounds, great unit!
reviews.text: We just returned from a week at the Papakea resort just north of Ka'anapali in Maui. We loved the location - close to Lahaina (ten minutes) and within an hour of Makena and Hookipa. Our unit, G102, was a ground floor unit, which I was initially hestitant about, but we ended up loving it! The easy pool and beach access and gorgeous view of the koi pond were wonderful. After arriving at night, waking up to the stunning view of Lani and Molokai was tremendous! For a beachfront condominium complex, the Papakea has some really pretty property to walk - many of the condos just seem to be slammed up against the beachfront and very crowded. The management company (we rented through VRBO) and Papakea personnel were great (the owners are very friendly, too! They checked in with us about our stay)- never had any problems! The kitchen had recently been remodeled and had everything, which was great because we cooked in alot. The property has many grills, too. We liked that it wasn't a huge complex, but it was very family oriented. We will definitely be back!

reviews.title: Don't want to leave
reviews.text: I was so nervous about staying here after reading the many mixed reviews. We booked directly with the owner and the unit was wonderful - 1 bedroom w/ a loft. Remodeled kitchen w/ granite counters, new cabinets and new stainless steel appliances. Remodeled bathrooms w/ granite counters. The wall air-conditioning unit was more than adequate to cool the unit - upstairs and down. Beautiful grounds - less than 300 feet from the ocean. Just sitting on the lanai was so peaceful and relaxing.

reviews.title: Papakea is just okea!
reviews.text: I have to admit - looking into windows, the units are varied. Some still have the old white cabinets w/ laminate countertops - ugh. I wouldn't be a happy person if I was staying in one of those units. I want a nice place when I'm on vacation

reviews.title: My Stay at Papakea
reviews.text: We went to the breakfast orientation - DO NOT go to the Hyatt Regency luau. Contrary to what the Expedia concierge has to say about it - it's ovepriced, they use cheapest alcohol I've ever tasted (reminds me of 10c alcohol night in college) and the food is yuck.. You can't even get a blended drink - don't you want a Pina Colada when watching a Hawaiian dance?? For more than a $100/person - it is the biggest scam on the island.

reviews.title: Love Papakea A 202
reviews.text: This is the second year we've stayed at Papakea in A 202. It's the fifth time we've stayed at Papakea overall. It's a great place for us! It has beautiful mature grounds with some of the biggest koi we've ever seen. We prefer a quieter property with the ammenities that are most important to us. That includes a nice pool area, grounds and of course great BBQ areas. We chose A 202 the first time because we wanted an oceanfront unit to watch whales from. That was in February of '07. We were so pleased with everything we found that we booked it a year in advance to make sure we could come back! This unit is located away from most of the "outside" hallway traffic. It has a beautiful view and the owner clearly works hard to make sure everything is clean and in order. We had a small problem when we first checked in this time and called the owner to ask for help. She called back 43 minutes later and APOLOGIZED for taking so long to call me back. That's CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!! The problem was solved immediately, well beyond our expectations! We're so pleased with everything that we've already booked for February of 09.

reviews.title: Wonderful!!
reviews.text: This was our first trip ever to Hawaii. I expected it to be a bit like the southern CA area with the beauty of palm trees and exotic flowers and plants. We were most definitely surprised by Maui's utmost beauty. We spent 11 marvelous days.

reviews.title: Loved the Papakea!!
reviews.text: We stayed in the ocean front condos in a corner unit and it was gorgeous! Our condo was very homey and nice. The kitchen was clean with modern appliances and it faced the ocean when preparing food on the counter.

reviews.title: Get an ocean front room
reviews.text: The living room was comfortable with a nice tv, sofa and big round dining room table. We put together a jigsaw puzzle on the table and enjoyed evenings in that living room. The decor was tropical with wicker furniture and artificial orchids (which looked real).

reviews.title: A-202 VRBO - Poor Accomodations
reviews.text: Our bedroom was nice and roomy with a big closet and dresser to keep our things in and also a safe in the closet. There was always a tradewind blowing through our room at night to keep things cool and although the days would get warm (about 82*), we never needed to use the airconditioner because of the breeze.

reviews.title: Not what we expected
reviews.text: Having traveled and stayed at many resorts in Mexico and the Caribbean, I had high expectations of Papakea Resort. When arriving and checking in we were greeted with a friendly Aloha, given our key and “free breakfast ticket” (you have to listen to a 30 talk on different tours to take). When walking up to L408 we noticed many construction workers and cats. We walked into our condo and saw plastic covering our ceiling and the décor was from the early 90’s. Our “two bedroom two bath” was also disappointing. We had requested one king and one queen. We received one queen bed and two twin beds that were located in a loft area. The only really good thing about our room was the view. Feet from the beach and ocean were definitely worth the 10 hour trip!

reviews.title: Dirty, Small and cramped.
reviews.text: Cleaning service was not what you would expect. They will change your sheets and sweep the floor if you write them a note. Otherwise expect only clean towels! That was even hard to come by. We ended up going to Star Market and getting our own cleaning products and taking care of our moldy showers and dusty tables.

reviews.title: No privacy!!! Will never stay again!!!
reviews.text: The pool area was fun and I would recommended getting their and relaxing before the children arrive! The pool security is really strict on the no floaties or beach balls in the pool. You can get beach towels at the front desk and be very careful with them. We placed them on the lanai one night, had high winds, and one flew off. The unethical grounds crew picked it up and did not turn it in. Needless to say we were charged 25 dollars. The grills had some kind of governor on them which would only allow them to get to 300 degrees. So plan on having dinner be cooking for a long time. Trust me we tried to turn them up and we found that the two end grills were the best.

reviews.title: Awesome Resort
reviews.text: Having traveled many places and having and high expectations made me realize that Papakea was not a 5 star resort. My recommendation would be to ask to a fully remodeled condo, be prepared to clean, and buy a beach towel at the ABC store. Any questions or to see pictures feel free to contact me.

reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Stay
reviews.text: For a family of 4, the units are cramped. With only one bathroom to use, there were some challenges. The staff was accommodating, however not overly informative. Extra charges for golf clubs to use on the putting green and for the safe key was dissappointing. Nickle and diming an already pricy getaway was sad. The unit we stayed in had a half tub and rotting wood around the floor as well as water stains in the ceiling area. While the location was great and the views were really nice, we would only stay there again if we are provided pictures of our room and guaranteed that room once we reviewed the pictures. Understanding that some units have been renovated more recently, it would be suggested that all units maintain a certain level of amenities and are renovated on a periodic basis.

description: A garden paradise on "The Magic Isle". This picturesque oceanfront resort is nestled amid 13 acres of lush tropical landscaping and expansive lawns bordered by flower-lined paths. The resort offers a variety of on-site amenities and activities - with restaurants, galleries and shops of Lahaina and Kaanapali Beach just moments away.
